content.text: How many points does the driver finishing in 1st place receive?
The driver finishing in 1st place receives 25 championship points in a standard Formula 1 race.
What are the points awarded for positions 1st through 10th?
Points are awarded as follows: 1st place - 25 points, 2nd - 18, 3rd - 15, 4th - 12, 5th - 10, 6th - 8, 7th - 6, 8th - 4, 9th - 2, 10th - 1 point.
Does the fastest lap earn any points?
The fastest lap in a Formula 1 race does not earn any points. The points are awarded based on the final race classification.
What are the main components of an F1 power unit?

An F1 power unit consists of: 1) Internal Combustion Engine (ICE) - 1.6L V6 turbo, 2) MGU-K (Motor Generator Unit - Kinetic), 3) MGU-H (Motor Generator Unit - Heat), 4) Turbocharger, 5) Energy Store (battery), 6) Control Electronics.
What is parc fermé and when does it apply?

Parc fermé is a period where cars are in a restricted area and limited work can be performed. It begins when cars exit the pit lane for qualifying and continues until the start of the race. During this time, only specific permitted work is allowed.
Can teams make setup changes after qualifying?

No, after qualifying, cars enter parc fermé conditions where setup changes are prohibited. Only specific repairs and adjustments (like front wing angle) are permitted. Any significant changes require starting from the pit lane.
What is the minimum time for a pit stop?

There is no minimum pit stop time mandated by regulations. However, practical pit stops typically take 2-3 seconds for a tyre change. Teams must ensure safe releases without endangering other competitors or personnel.
How many mechanics can work on a car during a pit stop?
The regulations do not specify a limit on the number of mechanics that can work on a Formula 1 car during a pit stop.
What is the pit lane speed limit during the whole Competition unless changed by the Race Director?
The pit lane speed limit during the whole Competition is typically 80 km/h, unless changed by the Race Director.
How many free practice sessions are held when a sprint session is not scheduled?
When a sprint session is not scheduled, there are typically three free practice sessions held during a race weekend.
How many drivers may each Competitor use in races during a Championship?
Each Formula 1 team can enter two cars in the championship. The drivers for those two cars must be named in the team's application to compete in the championship.
Which components are not considered to be bodywork?
Cameras and housings, rear view mirrors, the ERS status light, mechanical parts of the power train or steering system, wheel rims and tyres, and brake disc assemblies, calipers, and pads.
